name: Singer-Songwriter
description: Heavily focused on lyrics and songwriting, with musical accompaniment tending to take lower precedence.

sub_genres.name: Avtorskaya pesnya
sub_genres.description: Originating in the Soviet Union taking cues from forms of Russian Romance and Russian poetry with the main focus on lyrics.

sub_genres.name: Canzone d'autore
sub_genres.description: Music of the Italian Singer-Songwriters that emerged in the 1960s and early 1970s, initially influenced by French Chanson with the addition of uniquely Italian sensibilities.

sub_genres.name: Chanson à texte
sub_genres.description: French-language songs emphasising sophisticated and poetic lyricism.

sub_genres.name: Euskal kantagintza berria
sub_genres.description: Basque genre born during the 1960s inspired by Nova cançó and Chanson.

sub_genres.name: Kleinkunst
sub_genres.description: Dutch-language genre from the Netherlands and Flanders with influences from Cabaret, protest songs, Chanson, and folk.

sub_genres.name: Liedermacher
sub_genres.description: German style having its origins in literature and theatre rather than American forms like Blues or Rock.

sub_genres.name: Música de intervenção
sub_genres.description: Wave of Portuguese singer-songwriters in the 1960s and 1970s who agitated against the Estado Novo regime and the colonial war waged by Portugal against national liberation fronts.

sub_genres.name: Nova cançó
sub_genres.description: Arose in Catalonia during the Franco dictatorship, sung in Catalan as a way to resist restrictions placed on regional languages in Spain and retain a regional identity.

sub_genres.name: Nueva canción
sub_genres.description: Latin American (Nueva canción latinoamericana) and Spanish (Nueva canción española) movement during the 1960s and 1970s.

sub_genres.name: Nòva cançon
sub_genres.description: Arose in the Occitania region of southern France, sung in the Occitan language as a way to preserve their culture and resist forced usage of French.

sub_genres.name: Poezja śpiewana
sub_genres.description: Polish sung poetry; the poem is the centerpiece of a song, often with sparse instrumental accompaniment.

sub_genres.name: Trova
sub_genres.description: One of the most ancient expressions of Cuban Music, based around lone Singer-Songwriters who use nothing but a guitar as their preferred accompaniment and place emphasis on lyrics.
